alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 4:42PM MST until August 31 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 PM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. The Arivaca Altar Basin gauge has measured 0.87" of rain in 30 minutes. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cedar Creek, Arivaca Creek, Yellow Jacket Wash, Guijas Wash, Las and Fraguita Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arivaca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
